issue.title: [CF 1021] Player Unit Condition Spell In Range
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Import the string and log into a warrior character that has Commanding Shout
2. Remove all Stamina Buffs from your character and do not be in a group
3. Note that the icon does not appear as is expected.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
This icon is set to look at raid 1-40; party 1-4; player.  If a BonusStamina buff is missing, the unit in question is a player and in range of Commanding Shout, and I can cast Commanding Shout and I am a warrior, then appear.

Instead the icon does not appear.  Changing the Unit condition of "Is in range" to "is not in range" will cause the icon to appear.  It would seem that the unit condition of spell in range isn't behaving correctly for the player unit (at least for commanding shout).  This is the same symptom for Battleshout.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
TMW v7.1.2

Do you have an error log of what happened?
No

comments.body:
Commanding Shout is self-cast, so it has no range. Use a Unit Range condition to check if units are close enough to receive it.

Edited Nov 9, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you! That indeed was the problem.


> Posted by CurseForge user matthttam
